title: The astonishing embryo models of Jacob Hanna
summary: When the Palestinian stem-cell scientist Jacob Hanna was stopped while entering the US last May, airport customs agents took him aside and held him for hours in โsecondary,โ a back office where you donโt have your passport and canโt use your phone. There were two young Russian women and a candy macโฆ
body: When the Palestinian stem-cell scientist Jacob Hanna was stopped while entering the US last May, airport customs agents took him aside and held him for hours in โsecondary,โ a back office where you donโt have your passport and canโt use your phone. There were two young Russian women and a candy machine in the room with him. Hanna, who has a trim beard and glasses and holds an Israeli passport, accepted the scrutiny. โItโs almost like you are under arrest, but in a friendly way,โ he says. He agreed to turn over his phone and social media for inspection.   โThey said, โYou have the right to refuse,โโ he recalls, โand I said, โNo, no, itโs an open book.โโ The agents scrolling through his feeds would have learned that Hanna is part of Israelโs small Arab Christian minority, a nonbinary LGBTQ-rights advocate, and an outspoken critic of the Gaza occupation, who uses his social media accounts to post images of atrocities and hold up a mirror to scientific colleagues including those at the Weizmann Institute of Science, the pure-science powerhouse where he worksโIsraelโs version of Caltech or Rockefeller University. In his luggage, they would have found his keffiyeh, or traditioโฆ
